message: When I use to work at a grocery store they had a this crappy break room in the back that was very dark and smelly. However, they coke machine only cost $0.20 and I honestly thought that was the most amazing thing.

The docs make it sound like it treats whatever's returned as a JS source file.  I guess if the only contents are a global function invocation that handles the response then I guess I can see it working, but I'm pretty sure $.getJSON is what you want.
that's the flag to jQ to generate a unique ID for the handler
the server returns: parsePocketHotlineResponse({json encoded users})
Hmm, never actually used $.getScript — what's the response look like?
http://p.fermion.us/0K3m3L3p0K2n0o020v2D
Did you try appending "callback=?" to the query string for the X domain JSONP request?
I am
its basically a helper for a jsonp request, i couldn't get json to work cross domain (but this is the first time ive ever tried)
i thought that's what getScript did for me, but maybe not
I know for a fact that appending the magic callback=? to your URL with $.getJSON will enable cross-site requests ;-)

- f.inputs do
    %li.text.optional
      %label#reservation_reason_for_cancel_input Reason for #{@reservation.pending? ? 'denying' : 'cancellation'}
      = text_area_tag "reservation[reason_for_canceling]", "", :rows => 20
      %p.inline-hints.align-with-inputs
        -if @reservation.pending?
          An email notification of the rejection, including the reason you entered, will be sent to the renter.
        -else
          An email notification of the cancellation, including the reason you entered and any refund amount, will be sent to the renter.
yo! thanks for making this @nz
thats true, how does it handle formatting?

RH needs more promotion, also more stats, achievements, and some public API.
If I could get a badge on say, About.me, that'd be the coolest thing ever.
@chap If it was easier to log calls, I would.
(also i love the ideas about stats, achievements, etc. i have some thing in the works.)
It would give you more tangible data.
@krainboltgreene how can i make it easier?
@chap: Not quite sure. I'm just not one who likes to fill out long forms.
Oh, here, idea. We're a rails hotline. Not much we can really talk about that isn't focused on Rails. So instead of text boxes, check boxes.
[] Active Record Problem, [] Mongoid Problem, [] Redis Problem ...
also i like the idea of doing checkboxes for quicker entries
i hear what you're saying about the long form. none are required, but it is quite huge.
ive found myself popping open the call summary when i first take the call. then i can kind of just type notes along with the call.

OK, I just had a question a wasn't able to answer about Omniauth, which involved how you prevent users from creating multiple accounts when they sign in with different services. Then, I joined Convore to ask this question, and I saw their solution, which is to just ask the users if he/she wants to create a new account or link an existing one.
Woops, that was the cat.
Just created a list of all you amazing folks: http://twitter.com/#!/list/railshotline/rails-hotline-volunteers
haha
It's like some sort of Zen thing where asking the question provides the answer.
HA
@krainboltgreene you need PawSense: http://www.bitboost.com/pawsense/
also, are you aware that the "My Activity This Week" graph always shows 0 minutes talk time?
thanks :)
chap: feature request - can you make it so that we can view a list of our previous call reviews? It'd be nice to look back at
Are there any other public hotlines other than Rails?
thanks @nilbus good feature idea and i'll look into that 0 minutes thing
im working on it. the others are private at the moment.
you got anybody in mind?
nope, just curious
The rails one is a great idea
I'm having a lot of fun
you're killing it. i can't get to them fast enough :)
what's your favorite part about taking the calls?
I just like helping people with things I'm good at. It's quite satisfying when I can make someone's day or help them solve a problem
haha yeah
and I noticed. Thanks!
some other weird behavior: (using desktop layout) toggle the MyCallDuty iphone slider, and My Points changes to some low number until you reload the page
@krainboltgreene we're trying to find more business / communities to help us test it, if you know anybody
:D good idea
right now out of my consulting work, but we're trying to find businesses who would pay to sponsor their own hotline around their product or area of expertise
yeah, shes my baby :)
the core group is funded
i hear you. last week i helped a guy with jquery, and he was like "damn ive been working on this for 12 hours!"
I pushed a fix for your dashboard stats, should look correct now
Really great man. I'm going to look into it for other things.
both not too high priority
s/major/typical
seems like it would work particularly well for community-based projects that have a small core group of funded developers
@chap: Amazingly nice changes to the operator page :D
on the dashboard page
thanks guys. getting a little better everyday. fixing up the call review stuff now to give you more clarity into what you've done
Sweet. I'm really loving this. So what kind of platform is this on? Do you own Pocket Hotline?
@nilbus oh yeah, i saw that earlier. working on that too.
no, thanks, i love the feedback
also, mobile layout text color for My Recent Calls is white on light gray
@krainboltgreene: Any niche fans would totally love this. Example: D&D4 Hotline. Etc
and more so companies that have an interest in supporting their users
@chap: good call
i want to do a better mobile layout, very focused on what you would actually do on the phone, right now it tries to do much and looks junky
Once Pocket Hotline opens, totally using it :D
@chap: how is this funded?
i.e. Apple creates it's own "iphone hotline" and then fanboys like me take calls and then i get a discount on my next iphone
hmm
this might work very well with a company like Ubuntu
yeah
It's really difficult to see that flying in any major corporate environment
yeah, most big orgs are slow and dumb. but we've got a few small companies contacting us that want to give it a go. so we're starting there!
for sure, got a few nibbles from some other open source projects too
right. I could see it happening with small companies
the rails team I feel falls less into that category
thats a good idea, some of those companies that are built around open source
(like Rails!)
there's a passionate community behind it who would volunteer
but they also probably aren't spending money already on supporting users
good point
ok, im out guys, talk to you later.
I told him I'd pass that along
but I wouldn't mind RailsHotline receiving donations
This one guy is really interested in donating
personally I'd rather do this for free and have it be a volunteer thing. Once it becomes a paid thing, it's much less motivating
if you even want to do that
Just added an FAQ for "what if someone wants to donate money?" http://rails.pockethotline.com/faqs/16
agree with you on the volunteer thing. we've taken 1 donation because someone was adamant and wanted to pitch in on our hosting costs.
sounds good

I'm noticing that My Activity This Week is reporting 84 hours on call. I would expect this to mean 84 hours on duty, which has been closer to 8, probably. It has been 84 hours since I joined Rails Hotline. Is this a bug or intentional?
Yeah, found a bug with the "on call" calculation. Fix coming soon.
I find myself often looking at www.railshotline.com to see who else is on call. Any way we can either show that info on the dashboard or link to www.railshotline.com from there for easy access?
@nilbus I do the same thing! I think that should be on our dashboards too. Great idea.

Hi all.  Been on hiatus for a while, but went back on call now!
welcome back :)
Welcome!
Haven't gotten many calls recently when I'm on call. You guys?
Also, @krainboltgreene has some really good ideas about social promoting that I'm working on too
Yo @nilbus it's sort of a 2 way street. I'm working on a tool that will give us a more consistant schedule, so that people know when they can call.
Still love Rails Hotline! It got to be a bit much but I'll put myself as on-call until it gets to be too much again :)
